Im pretty sure I got a returned and/or repaired headset. Both ear pieces have scratches. Also, I searched for Anker Headphones because of the quality Ive gotten from them in the past. I thought thats the brand I was purchasing. These are not the quality of Anker and theyre more expensive. Wish Id given more attention to the products name. I though SuperEQ was an Anker line. Nope, not at all equivalent quality. Not even MPOW quality which run around $30-40. Im not happy with these headphones at all. Pretty sure Ill return them.

I've been enjoying these headphones often. I wasn't quite sure what I would get at the $60 range, but I've been pleasantly surprised. In a quirky bit of uniqueness, you're greeted by the voice of a fancy sounding British lady when you turn the power on. She says, "Power on...pairing." As you'd expect, the headphones are easy to pair to either your phone or computer. The main purposes I use them for are to listen to music, make phone calls, and for talking and listening on Zoom webcam sessions. Music sounds nice and full on these. I especially enjoy the bass response and smoothness it gives to my music. They seem especially good for electronic music, hip-hop, downtempo, and anything else of the like. If you'd prefer a different sound than the default though, you just double press a button on the headphone. I enjoy this design simplicity, The active noise cancelling is another helpful addition, helping me to listen to more of my music and less of my neighbors!

This headphone is well designed with excellent sound quality. Fits well for youth and adults. The advantage is you can connect two devices using bluetooth with latest bluetooth technology given in the headset. One more thing which I found good is you can use either with bluetooth wireless mode or with wire plugged into any device. BASS is really deep what they claim with external noise reduction/cancelling. Sound quality and design is better compare to other in the similar price range.

Have bought a few over the past few months and have been disappointed with them due to not having good noise cancellation. Used these last night with a very good outcome. My husband is a loud snorer and I watch TV in the evening on my tablet and i was able to block out his snoring. Thank goodness. Now that ive found a good pair i can by anothet for my Daughter so i dont disturb het listening to her music as i work from home. Great buy.

I have looked at several brands of noise canceling headphones, and finally decided to give these a try, based on other reviews. They are not wrong! These are AWESOME! I love them! The noise canceling settings are fantastic! The battery lasts a very long time- several hours, nonstop! They charge quickly. The earcups are comfortable and large enough to cover your ears, without squeezing too tight. I would definitely buy them, again!

This headset are a must buy. I got for my third grader who is doing remote School as well as my other son who is in K2. As you can imagine having two kids in the house and me working from home, my son will get very distracted so after his old headset broke I decided to give this one a try and I have not regret it all. My son says it truly cancels the noise. He is able to hear his classmates and teacher perfectly and they are able to hear him perfectly as well. No lagging and stays put even when he is doing PE with them on !

With a noisy kid around the house, my old regular headphones werent cutting it and I needed an upgrade. These noise canceling headphones work well! They definitely block out ambient noise better than my old headphones, and the muffs around the ear are very comfortable - so much so that my toddler loves to put them on for fun. I like the color of it as well, which is a sleek black with a red underside for some personality. I also like that these can easily be folded for travel or storage. It comes with a nice bag to put them in. The sound is clear. To be honest, as this is my first pair of noise canceling headphones, I cant judge how well it blocks out sound compared to other brands, but I can only say this is a big improvement for me from my regular headphones that Id been using. I can still hear my toddler screaming when I have these on, but I think something that would completely turn off that noise would be borderline magic ;) Im enjoying these and havent had issues so far.

I have been using this new bluetooth headphone for two weeks, and I have to say Im impressed and satisfied with them. The design and presentation are excellent with high quality put into the product. Wearing the headphones on my ears comforted me because even after listening for a long time, I don't feel pain or discomfort at all! There is quite a noticeable noise reduction with noise cancelling mode, and I couldnt really hear anything outside of my music in this mode. I would recommend this product to my friends for sure, as they are amazing and affordable!

Receive these today and I look nice plus they sound decent but the noise cancellation is nonexistent. I compared them with another brand that I purchased that arrived today as well and why you think I'm in a close bathroom with the exhaust fan on, to simulate an airplane noise, I could not tell any difference what is the noise cancellation on or off with this brand. The other brand has a very noticeable difference.

I needed a pair of over-the-ear headphones to wear while traveling and decided to give these a shot. As soon as you try on the headphones, you notice how well it cancels out noise. Then you try the active noise-cancellation feature and realize how well it eliminates outside noise even when music isnt playing. The sound quality and comfort is great for the price point. Im happy with my purchase

My ears don't do well with the type that go IN the ear so I thought I'd try these and I'm glad I did. I don't get earaches with these and they cancel sound much better than the in-ear ones I've had in the past. I mostly use these for listening to podcasts and audiobooks when I clean or do projects around the house. Battery lasts the whole time, several hours and still has strong power.

The headphones built quality is good. The quality is mediocre lacking a solid deep bass. The noise cancellation is below my expectation as compared to the low end Sony model 710. Overall, it is a good value headphones if ANC is not the highest priority.

Really nice and light headphones. The headphone fits snug and comfortable. The sound quality is good and battery life lasts long. Its not as loud as other brands but loud enough for indoor use and not too heavy on the head.  I like it for my children when they watch their tablets.

Very nice headphones got them for my nephew because he spends a lot of time listening to music he loves the bass of these earphones and it also has an excellent battery life great sound quality he wears them all the time he loves the color and likes how they fit over his head highly recommended

Had these for about 3 months now and the charging port is already malfunctioning. When you plug it in you have to bend the cord around just right and hope it doesn't move for the connection to persist. Its not the cable because I have tried multiple cables and have same problem. Sound quality isn't bad and they are fairly comfortable but that doesn't matter if they aren't going to last more than 3 months.

The headphone pads fully encase your ear and are comfortable. It isn't a tight "circle" fit like some other models that give you a headache. Very impressive sound quality and bluetooth connectivity distance. They look, feel, and sound like something 3x their price and have excellent noise cancelation as well!

I ordered these after much research and they were not at all as described. The logo on the ear piece is cheap and just looks like a random sticker. They would not pair with my MacBook Pro and this was the main reason I bought them. I cannot speak to their battery life because they arrived fully charged and I returned them in the first 24 hours of use. They are very heavy in comparison to their competitors. I would not purchase these again nor would I recommend them.  The head band bears most of the weight so that means the top of your head will feel pressure during use.  The noise cancellation left much to be desired but it does cancel some of the outside noise, just not everything.  For an adult working from home looking for true noise cancelling, I would keep looking.  With the heaviness of the head band, and the mid quality of the speakers, I would not buy these again. Good luck !! Good noise canceling headphones under $100 are hard to find.

For the price of these headphones I would say the quality and how comfortable they are is definitely there. I could see myself definitely buying these again/ as a gift for relatives etc. I would say the sound quality is not as good as a $300 pair of headphones but that is definitely expected, but also its not that far off in terms of the quality

I just got the headphone three days ago .The  design is what I like. Wearing them for two or three hours wont hurt my ears , and that is very important to me. Second, its perfect noise cancellation function gives me a good experience. But the sound is not as bright as the AirPods. Third, it is easy to carry . In general, its worth the price. I will give five stars.
Great sound. They look great. I have small ears but they still sort of sit on my lobes uncomfortably after a while. Could be that I don't put them in enough!?

Awesome battery life - I go by several days without charging it. Noise cancelling option works great. I turn it on along with some music and outside noises are cancelled out. Sound quality is good but not perfect. Lots of bass so I enjoy it very much with chill-heavy-bass beats. Overall quality is GOOD. Looks high-end but is definitely made of quality materials. However, this does not compromise comfort - still feels great when wearing them.
Great! Its helping me at home and at the office. And its beautiful!

I love the deep bass. This is an important quality I look for in any headphone I buy. The only tiny thing I would change is I wish when the gets turned up louder I don't want everyone else hearing the sound. Other than that these headphones are amazing.

Very good product. Love these headphones. My whole family uses them even my young son. The noise cancelling works really well. They are comfortable to wear and dont hurt my head or ears. The sound quality is very good its very clear. Overall a very good purchase.
Nice headphones. I hate having my ears smushed, so I'm really happy with how comfortable these are. And they're very easy to connect via bluetooth which is always a relief.

You can understand me better if you are taught in a language other than your native language. Especially in online education, you definitely need a headset. I bought this headset to get the sound more clearly in online meetings and I think it works. Previously, I had a hard time understanding the professor because the sound was streamed from the computer. The same is true for phone calls. I have been trying this product for 2 days and I am very satisfied for now. I hope there is no battery problem.
Wonderful noise cancellation considering the price. Base side of the sound is more clear. Treble could be i little better. But at this price, its a wow product.

I got this for my girlfriend as a Christmas Gift and she loved it. She enjoys listening to music while working and she says she doesn't even feel like the headphones weigh anything. The noise cancelling was so good that she could not even hear the what was going on in the room. She says these headphones have really nice sound quality along with a long battery life. I would recommend this as a gift for someone who really enjoys listening to music and focusing.

I was looking for mainly for over the ear (no sweating in ears) headphones, battery life, Noise Cancellation. I think my decision in buying this headphones is correct. I charged for 2-4 hrs and I am using for last 3 days for all my office meetings almost 6+ hrs a day. Buttons for noise cancellation, volume, call management are very handy.

Product delivered with foldable/adjustable Headset(wired/wireless Bluetooth), travel on plane(adapter plug) , quality headset pouch. Headset has volume buttons, power button, and ANC buttons for calls/media/ambient/anti noise cancellation mode operations. Very comfortable ear pads over ear. It has good sound clarity while travelling outside with ANC feature on. Battery lasting for 30 hrs if used continuously. Good for long office calls or movie watch.
Very poor quality,  they make a humming noise in the background and Bluetooth does not work reliably.  There are better options for the money.  Don't buy!

Comes with a nice soft leather drawstring bag. The battery didnt need to be charged, and right out of the case, we got about 4 hours of listening.  I charged it before it was needed.  My husband turned On the noise canceling, and fell asleep in a room of loud children while listening to music. My son was able to relax while wearing them. It was easy to pair with two devices, and also with the wired connection to Nintendo switch.  We are happy with our purchase.  They adjusted easily for both adult and child. They fold to store easily.

Absolutely worth the money. My wife works at home and I use these to watch tv while she works. Comfortable and great sound quality for the price. Im not an expert but I can imagine there might be better ones if money isnt a concern but if your ears are not fine tuned for very small intricacies, these are absolutely wonderful for the price. Good bass, sound clarity, battery life, and all. Highly recommend.

Incredibly comfortable on the head, not too much pressure but feels secure enough to go run with.  The sound quality is great, a little heavy on the bass but not terribly so.  These are for sure not Bose headphones, but they're also not $300.  Great bang for the buck, noise cancellation works fine in every situation I've tested them in, though I haven't tried them on a plane yet.  The only thing I don't love is the words on the cups and the headstrap, but it's not a deal breaker.  Battery life is incredible!

Great Sound, long lasting batteries.. Headphones feel premium I am in love with white color in particular. They can adjust to fit head very well and are very comfortable to use... I love hearing my audibles for hours on it, it has got amazing noise cancelling which helps me to be in my zone and enjoy every bit of what I am listening. It was extremely to easy to pair with my desktop, laptop and my phone. It is well built and made of good quality. Really happy with the purchase...

I've been able to test these headphones for some time now, and I have to say that its a well built pair of headphones. They're very comfortable so my ears don't get tired, and the sound quality is good too. Overall, I would say these are a great bang for your buck, might purchase another for my mother.

Won't pair. I asked to return and get a refund. This isn't an Amazon return, so no easy QR code. I have to print three labels, which I can't because my printer just died. I emailed the labels to the local UPS store. They don't go through. I finally had to purchase the labels at a cost of $1. DO NOT BUY. RETURNING IS A HUGE HASSLE.

Utter garbage.  I may have been spoiled after using pricier ANC headphones for so long.  I guess you do get what you pay for. The sound quality is awful, and ANC is non-existent, just some white noise that comes in an attempt unsuccessfully drown out noise.

So, bought these because my other headset broke and I am very happy to date with the quality of the sound. Now I know these are not Boces but for my simple purposes of listening to podcasts and clearing up the speech on some videos it works just fine. I think the average person will be happy with this purchase.

Great noise cancellation, quality is excellent. I bought it for my son and he enjoys it really well. He likes the color as well. He uses it to do school work, gaming and music.

I love this headphones! The noise cancellation is on point, the battery last extremely long, I charged them full the first day and I have been using them on daily baisis for 3 days and still at 80%. They are great! 100% recommended very comfortable and adjustable.

This headphone is not what I had expected from a $60 pair of headphone. The quality of sound, the weight, the ability of noise cancellation, and the color style is all something way better than my expectation. If you are looking for a noise cancellation, nice sound quality pair of headphone for a small price, SuperEQ S1 could be the best choice. The first item to note is that they have bluetooth 5.0 which means the connection range is pretty far. Since the bluetooth 5.0, the data transfer requests very low energy which means this headphone can pack a 30+ hour battery cruising life with all possible features on. If you want to have longer running time, then you can choose to turn off a couple of features. The noise cancellation functionality is the best part of this headphone. It has light weight and performs great sound. The bass is the most impressive part of it. People that do not want bass may want to stay clear of these, but from my testing I really enjoyed the sound. It comes with a charging cable, and a carry pouch. The SuperEq S1 is a great pair of headphone. In my opinion it provides a great sound quality and the noise cancellation ability with an affordable price. It is comfortable and has a great battery life. I would suggest this pair of headphone to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive, nice sounding, and noise cancellation headphone.

These headphones were amazing! I got these for my nephews 12th birthday. He is really into gaming and animating and he really wanted a pair of beats but they were a little on the pricey side so I went with these and they are great! He loved the headphones. They delivered in a nice package, on time, and he loves them! I cant tell if the noise cancelling is so good that he cant hear me when I say its time to stop playing or if he is just ignoring me lol I will definitely be ordering these again.  Great price for a great quality headphone!

My daughter loves to listen to music, but doesnt like using earbuds. So my wife and I decided to get her some headphones. We dont have a huge budget for these kinds of gifts so we went on a limb with this brand. I was actually blown away with the sound quality and functionality of these headphones. I own an old pair of Bose noise canceling headphones and these ones remind me of them. I tested them with a variety of songs and they all sound great. The controls on the headphones are easy to use as well. My daughter loves them, which is the most important part. Im very impressed with the Super EQ headphones
Just does not fit right. Was real sick and did not return properly.

I bought this headphones because its wireless and good price, but turned out much better than I expected. Its light weight and very comfortable to wear all day. The sounds quality is great because its completely noise cancellation. Battery life is also long enough to last me about 8 hrs at work. I also like how it folds up so easy to pack for travel. I take it with me to work everyday.

I was impressed with the sound quality of these headphones. I bought them for my son for our trip, and they worked perfectly. We had a long car ride, and I was worried they wouldnt hold a charge long enough, but they lasted the whole way there, and most of the way back. Great battery life! And the sound is really good. I feel like for the price these are a great buy!! I would definitely recommend these to anyone looking.

I always take the class online. My kid always noise and make me don't pay attention. My brother tell me about this product. I tried and feel good with it. The sound is good and quality. Bought this headset as a gift for my nephew and he was very happy with it. Its very well built and the sound quality is pretty impressive for the price of the headset. I used to use a different High-range brand before, but these headphones have definitely overdone them when it comes to the bass and treble. However, my head's a little smaller in size and I have to adjust it a little sometimes. Other than that, I'm really happy.

NC ist in Ordnung, allgemein ist mir der Sound zu dumpf, der Sitz zu eng und die Polster bringen meine Ohren zum glhen. Ich habe noch nie so unter Kopfhrern geschwitzt. Ich habe diese Kopfhrer bestellt, da sie eine sehr gute Bewertung haben. Zunchst war ich skeptisch, muss allerdings sagen, dass diese Kopfhrer in jedem Punkt mit meinen alten Beats Studio mithalten knnen und das auch noch zu einem sehr fairen Preis. Die Klangqualitt ist wunderbar und hat auch mit hohen Bssen keinerlei Probleme. Die Akkulaufzeit beluft sich bei tglicher Nutzung auf ungefhr zwei Wochen. Am positivsten berrascht war ich jedoch von der integrierten Noise-Canceling-Technologie. Selbst in lautem Umfeld hrt man nichts von diesem, bis man das Noise-Canceling wieder deaktiviert. Alles in allem super Kopfhrer mit klasse Sound fr einen geringen Preis im Vergleich zu anderen Herstellern! Definitiv eine Kaufempfehlung wenn man nach Spitzenqualitt im Mittelpreissegment sucht.

Die Bedienung und Handhabung ist einfach und fast selbsterklrend. Erst nach mehreren Stunden fingen die Kopfhrer etwas an zu drcken, aber das ist kein Vergleich mit meinen sonstigen Erfahrungen. quality made with nice noise cancellation, premium sound quality, and pretty good battery.  I charged when arrived and used it almost every day but haven't need charge yet.  Prime headphone with reasonable price.

Wow, this headset is good. It came exactly as described in the description and it was very lightweight and the sound was very clear but its a bit heavy to wear for a long time. Bluetooth connection was ok and the noise cancelling feature was also good.

A truly excellent headset at a great price. Pros: - the sound clarity and quality is excellent. - the bass is great! - the microphone works well. - charges quickly and lasts as long as stated. - foldable design makes it easy to carry in my backpack without taking much space. - the black and red colour ensemble is elegant. - Bluetooth set up was quick and easy. - ANC works well  doesnt completely block background but significantly reduced it. - ambient setting works a treat and performs as expected. - comfortable to wear but does begin to become slight uncomfortable after wearing continuously for about 3 hours. - come with a PU leather-like storage pouch (though I would have preferred a hard case for ultimate protection). Cons: none whatsoever! Would be happy to recommend this headset as its price-value ratio is outstanding. Great for working from home, as an extra set or replacement, for casual use and perfect for adults and teens alike. Feels very robust and delivers excellent battery life and quality sound. A real example of not sacrificing quality for price. If this review helped, please click on the helpful button to let others know! Thanks

These are nice looking headphones and the design will appeal to a younger audience  I would say teens to twenties. They are light and comfortable to wear and fold down well with a nice looking plastic leather carry bag. The headphones connect straightaway to my iPhone and have a pretty good Bluetooth range  I can leave my phone in the kitchen and walk around adjoining rooms without losing connection. They also seem to charge quickly and hold their charge for the times Ive been using them  probably two hour sessions at the longest. I tend to listen to podcasts and pop and light rock music. I think the sound on these headphones for those is OK. I also have a set of Jabra headphones which at time of writing are 10 more expensive than these and the sound quality is so much clearer and crisper. Similarly, my wife has a set of Panasonic headphones which are 10 cheaper  and again I think they sound better. So for the price point I would shop around - especially if your music tastes are in the pop and guitar based rock genres.

I did not expect these headphones to be as good as they are, I own really cheap headphones and more expensive ones and for the price of these (59.99) I thought they would not sound good, but I was wrong the sound on these is really good I like my music to have abit of bass and you can definitely hear it with these. The build quality is fantastic they come presented in a nice box with a lovely draw string bag, these also fold down making them perfect for when you are out. The button's where abit hard to work out at first, but I now have got the hang of them. These also have noise cancelling which for the price range work pretty well and ambient mode so you can still hear what's going on around you. I wore these for around 4 hours and they where really comfortable and did not hurt my head or ears, the charge also seems to be lasting well. Overall if your looking for decent headphones at a great price then these are great would make a lovely present as the sound, build and quality is amazing.

These are a good pair of headphones and feature a build quality that is very good given the price. I found these very comfortable when on the head.  There is a reasonably good padded silicone inner headband which doesn't slide around and the speakers are also padded well and when I wore them with my glasses I didn't experience any discomfort.  I have small ears so they fitted nicely over them but if you are larger eared, you may find that instead of going over they kind of sit on and that may be a bit uncomfortable.  For me the buttons are the weak point.  They are functional but I found them to be rather "plasticky" and "clicky" and that scratchiness is transferred through the ear cup. Design-wise these look great and I love the black and red design with the flash of chrome/steel.  However if I could change anything, I would get rid of the phrases found on either side of the headband (I know, I know, I sound so old).  It's just as a middle aged family man, the "Be Young" and "Be Free" messaging falls rather flat... as I am neither. Lifting my spirits somewhat from that mid-life crisis realisation, I'm pleased to say that the sound quality on these is very good.  You get a good bass heavy soundscape.  Mids and Trebles are of course there, but I feel it definitely leans more to the bass. These also come with two sound modes.  First is ambient sound mode which lets in background noise and this works well.  When activated you can hear other people talking to you without having to remove the headphones. The second mode is the noise cancellation and I can report that this is good.  I tested it out with our bathroom's extractor fan running and when enabled, the rattly fan silenced to a quiet murmur.  On a plane these would definitely reduce that persistent hum. The speakers fold to make a smaller profile and there is a faux leather bag included to carry these around.  Also included are a 3.5 mm jack headphone cable and 2 prong 3.5 mm adaptor so that when on a plane these can be plugged into your phone or planes entertainment system. So for just under 60 (at the time of writing) these are a pretty decent pair of headphones that are great for working or travel.

Really nicely made headphones, especially because they are bluetooth, have Active Noise Cancellation and they also last for absolutely ages on battery, even with ANC enabled. They have decent built in controls using the buttons on the side of the headphones. They are super easy to pair and really convenient to just have in your bag. The accessories that it comes with are also pretty incredible for the money, you get an Aux cable, an airline adapter, charging cable and a nice little carrying bag which just makes them feel even more premium than they are. The only thing that I don't really love is the fact that sometimes when making calls it makes a strange background noise, this goes away as soon as the call ends but it is still strange. And also the fact that the power button does many things depending on how long you hold it for. This means that sometimes it is a guessing game as to whether they will turn off or whether they will go into bluetooth pairing mode. Overall for the money they are a really solid pair of headphones and the ANC isn't even too horrible. Obviously not up to the level of Bose or Sony but they don't have to be when they are only 60 and built really nicely.

For their mid-range price point, these Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones from SuperEQ have a decent quality to the sound. Bass is good if you like it loud and heavy over hearing some of the detail and, yes, treble is present though a little weaker but it most definitely loses a little in the middle that prevents the music from coming alive if you're used to much more expensive sets.  That said, with these 3 to 5 times cheaper, they're perfectly good for a daily commute or just to sit around and listen to music. The build quality, however, is good with a nice drawstring bag and decent folding action these headphones are ideal to carry around.  The battery seems to last ages, too, on a single charge and the noise cancelling isn't bad for the price (just don't expect miracles), it's a little fiddly with a single button turning on and off the noise cancelling and the ambient sound.  Standard forward/backward buttons double as volume up/down with a power and pairing button in the centre of them.  There's an AUX in for wired connections (cable included) and charging is via Micro USB, sadly not USB C. The only negative about the build is for those with larger heads as these feel fairly tight, though perhaps better suited for teenagers wanting their first pair of decent wireless headphones. So, yes, they're pretty good for the price, it seems that these new cheaper brands have found a way to vastly improve quality over the last few years so most people will be happy with the quality of a set headphones like this without having to pay a fortune for it.

I'm actually very impressed with these headphones. Seeing the price I was a little sceptical about the ANC in them and assumed the sound would be bad or the ANC not too strong. I was very wrong. Sound quality is balanced and has really good stereo separation between L & R channels and the bass is clean and not too overpowering. A little more low end would be nice but generally it's a pleasant listen. The mods and highs are well balanced and overall you get a fairly rich sound at this price point and even at some headphones much higher priced. Sound wise the only negative is overall volume, its not too low but a little boost higher would be better. The ANC has three modes. On, Off and Ambient. The difference between On & Off is subtle but it's there. The cups do a good job of blocking external noise anyway but you can hear the ANC working when there's no music playing and when it's on, you get very good isolation. The ambient mode works great to allow you to hear what is happening through the music and it works well. There's a very small delay on sounds but its only very slight. The headphones themselves are a little smaller than expected so they're quite tight on my head or around the neck, but not uncomfortably so and the ear cups are soft so do a good job of cushioning your ears when on The only annoying thing here is that they use micro USB to charge! Come on, it's 2020, just use USB C!!! All around I'm very impressed and they do a much better job than I anticipated. A great price point for a very capable product!

Materials: Plastic headband with memory foam cushion on the inside. Memory foam earpads with leather cover. Impressions: Battery lasts me over a week, it's amazing! Built in Mic Works fine with my iPhone 11 Can connect to two devices simultaneously. The headband is very flexible and doesn't break easily. Earpads keep my ears warm on the inside, but don't steam me when indoors. Remarks: The bass levels aren't high at all! Ambient sound is ok, but active noise cancelling gives me a headache because i can almost hear a very high pitch tone blocking it. When outside or running you can hear a serious wind howl, which means the aerodynamics on the sides of each earphone needs to be improved. It's actually so loud that it begins to interfere with whatever I'm listening. My first impression with these SuperEQ S1 headphones was to the roof, however after using them for a month i noticed a few things began troubling me over time! The materials used are good quality, plastic headband has a long elastic region or i.e. they can be bent/deformed a lot without breaking and still return to the original shape. There is also a hinge on each earphone which allows it to move around 20 for better fit. The leather on the earphones is impressive the least as it's very soft and fully protects my ears ( i have big ears) from sound & cold weather. But when indoors my ears don't get steamed up. Battery is amazing, one charge takes around 90 minutes and then it lasts me over a week! Very impressive. Microphone isn't bad either, people say they can hear clear & loud when I'm connected to my iPhone 11, without hearing too much of the background noise. Music quality: Standard music and podcasts can be heard sharp and clean, however i listen to a lot off deep bass songs and unfortunately these headphones just aren't meant for it. The bass isn't deep at all and there is no treble whatsoever. Active noise cancellation: It does the job surprisingly well, when in metro or noise streets and turned on i can't hear any of that. I decided to give it a go and try while playing on my computer but after an hour or so I get a headache because of the sound that's phase-inverted by 180 degrees, it's weird but i can almost feel a very low noise pitch when its ON. Ambient sound: This is a new thing for me, never tried it before but its a great addition as I can wear the headphones and still talk to people or listen to announcements at the station/airport. However there is a bit of static noise that can be heard and unfortunately it lowers the sound quality. Bluetooth: Range is high, it definitely covers 10 meters and the V5.0 is used. What surprised me is that the headphones can be connected to several devices at once! I really wished that i could give them 5 stars but um there are just too many discrepancies that need fixing, but these are definitely good budget noise cancellation headphones that will do the job.

These over-ear headphones come with a drawstring bag, charging cable, aux cable. They come pre-folded to keep the packaging small. The headphones themselves are black, with a red textured band that runs along the inside of the headphones; this textured band adds my grip to your head; The headband is adjustable. The earpiece has a thick soft cushion, to cover your ears; each side has an "L" or "R", you know which is the left and right. On the right has the onboard controls, ".", "o" & ".." ( "-", "OK" & "+" to you and me) see below functions. The button on its own is the Ambient button. "."  :  Volume down & (long press ) previous track "o"  :  Play/ Pause music  for calls Pick up/ end call & (long press ) reject call ".."  :  Volume Up & (long press ) next track The headphones have 3 mics; one on the left, and two on the right; These mics are inconspicuous, and just looks like a design for the headset. The topmost mics are for measuring outside noise and bringing the ambient noise into the earpiece. The second mic on the right is for phone calls. I found pairing these with my computer and mobile a doodle; (maybe I am used to pressing and holding the "O" button to enter pairing mode, and I did that instinctively) find the headphone and pair; that is it. I found these headphones, have a good sound, a deep bass, and high tweets. The pairing is super easy. I like that these headphones support dual concurrent Bluetooth connections; so you can link to a phone and computer and watch a movie on your computer and switch to mobile when necessary. The ambient mode allows outside sounds into the headphones; this can be very helpful for example when cycling, with headphones, this lets traffic noise in. At 49.99 at the time of review, I would recommend these headphones, they have a good sound, good styling, good price, and dual connectivity. Pros - Good styling - Good sound - Dual concurrent connectivity - Easy pairing - Good price Cons - Even folded, is still bulky, but that the nature of over-ear headphones.

Ive been left really impressed with the headphones, they are perfect in nearly everyway and the ANC technology in these is excellent! They came delivered nicely packaged in a well-presented retail box and along with the headphones you get a travel pouch, charge cable, 3.5mm AUX cable, airplane adapter, and the user guide. Im pleased with the quality of them, the plastic feels strong and durable, they arent too lightweight that they feel cheap, the ear cups and headband are very soft and comfortable, and they generally look nice when your wearing them. The headphones are comfortable to wear and grip your head quite tightly, so they wont be falling off if you decide to go for a run with them. Pairing them with my Galaxy S20+ was simple and they were up and running in seconds. The sound quality is very good and Im quite impressed with them to be honest, the sound is clear, well-balanced and you get a nice amount of bass from them. I would like them to be a bit louder when in Bluetooth mode, but the max volume is fine when using the wired connection and it seems to be an issue most BT headphones suffer with anyway. Call quality while using them is good, I can hear the person clearly and they can hear me with no issues. Without them even being switched on they do a great job of insulating sound from the outside and when you turn the ANC on you can barely hear any external noise at all. Im working from home at the moment but I have a fan heater which you can still hear while wearing the headphones until the moment you turn ANC on and the noise disappears, very impressive to be honest! The ambient mode also works well as it uses the mic to let you hear external sounds and you get a slight amplification so you can actually hear a bit better while wearing them. Overall, for around 60 I think these headphones are a great purchase and good value for money. The sound quality is great, battery life excellent, they are comfortable, and you get a good quality travel pouch with them which is a nice addition. Im very happy to recommend this item and I feel theyre worth the full five stars, I just wish they would go a little bit louder!

The only time Ive used noise-cancelling / wireless headphones before was when I worked for a game company and they didnt belong to me but it gives me a bit of an idea as to what these are like. These are really easy to set up  they even tell you when theyre on. You can charge them via a usb plug which is handy for me as I dont actually have a computer of my own. There's no indication that they're charging though. These look great  the finish isnt 100% perfect around the ear cushions / buttons but its not bad! They look very similar to a well-known brand and theyre really stylish  I actually like headphones over buds these days as they remind me of the 90's! The sound quality from these headphones is much better than my buds (I buy a mid-range brand)  it actually feels like surround sound and because of the noise-cancellation, I can easily get lost in my own little world. Theyre quite comfortable to wear but I have quite a small head and you can adjust the size, it's a bit stiff though. The cushions even keep my ears warm. Importantly you can still use these wired (the supplied cable isnt very long)  so I can plug them straight into a device without bluetooth if need be. They are collapsing and come in a nice little bag to keep them safe. They also come with a warranty that you can activate.

I ordered this product as love to listen to music, whether this being whilst working out or going on a walk. Came in a nice box fit for the headphones. Could definitely be given as a gift. What I liked when opening the product was the fact it comes with a wire connection if bluetooth isn't your sort of thing. Although personally I use bluetooth I liked that there was this for the option. Many other bluetooth headphones/earphones don't offer this. The product design is superb, very comfortable and look good! Could wear every day doing different things whilst still looking good. The headphones are of a high sound quality. Can also reach a very loud volume. These two things are key for me with headphones, and for both meet my expectations. The price I think is reasonable. Better sound quality than cheaper alternatives, also with a more luxury feel. Overall these headphones are impressive, they fold for a nice fit into the carry bag which is included. It has cool features like noise cancelling which is nice for zoning into work forgetting the outside world. They also play high quality music with a long lasting battery meaning more time of use without needing to be charged. I would recommend this product.

I must admit my expectations were low, when you see things like "hybrid Active" and "Super EQ" it reminds me of cheap rubbish with poor quality drivers, terrible bluetooth audio and awful software but these are far from that. Although they remind me a little of Dre Beats in style they are very comfortable, more comfortable than some Beats, the cup completely surrounds my ears so I get a good seal on my head, which not only helps with noise reduction but also keeps the bass nice & tight. They can be used wired or wirelessly, but you will need to keep the battery topped up to be able to use them in either mode. They come with a cable as well as a 3.5mm doubler, I assume that is for a games console, I don't know. It comes with a nice leatherette much to keep them in and a very short micro usb cable. Sound quality is pretty good, nice bass, crisp highs and clear mids for vocals Pairing was a cinch, initial power up found them and powered them on in pairing mode The noise cancelling effect can be disabled and enabled using the button on the bottom, the headphone voice announces the mode when the button is pressed. It works pretty well especially for low frequency noise...I live right beat to a main road and it gets rid of the majority of the noise from the road, I could fall asleep wearing them it that quiet, all I can hear is my tinnitus.

I'm not an audiophile, so this review is entirely subjective, but I'm really impressed with these headphones. The packaging is pretty plain, but the headphones themselves feel premium. They fold down into a compact size, I have a large head, but they adjust to fit my head really well and are very comfortable to wear. They come with a soft travel case and an adapter to use with in-flight entertainment systems if you so choose. Pairing the headphones with my Galaxy S10 was ridiculously easy. Press the "pair" button for a few seconds and scan for the headphones. They show up as "SuperEQ S1". Done. Sound quality is deceptively good. I'm comparing this against a Bludio Turbine headset I use in the gym. These don't get as loud, and the bass isn't as punchy as my Bludio headset, but the clarity of the sound is MUCH better. Coupled with the noise cancelling feature, I'm much more immersed when listening to something with this headset. I have kids, and noticed when I wear these headphones I literally don't notice outside noise.  (Makes focusing on my work much easier) These headphones punch way above their price tag. I'm very happy.

Didn't want to spend a high dollar for noise cancelling when working in the workshop, so I got these.  Charged them up when they arrived which didn't take very long right out of the box, then popped them on and it synced with my phone right away when turning them on and selecting it on my phone. The sound when starting up discouraged me on what to expect, as it sounded weak and toneless.  Turned on the music to see how terrible it was going to be, to find out I was shocked at how GREAT it sounded.  It's not deep bass as I know some like, but its a great balance.  Running saws and equipment inside the workshop, the Noise Cancelling did a great job in dampening the noise so I can hear the music clearly.  Obviously you won't block ALL noise out, but I wore them for a few hours with music going and no issues what so ever. Overall, this is a great product to get without spending $300 for a set that does pretty much the same thing.

The sound is poor. Activating noise cancelling cuts so much of the music sound that the volume has to be turned up a lot. It's like a lot of the frequencies have been stripped too so the full sound does not appear to be there. As a headphone just for cutting out background noise the noise cancelling is good enough and the good fit over the ears helps. The bar over your head though is really uncomfortable. Perhaps if I had hair rather than short clipped they'd be comfortable. The adjustment to fit is poor too. The final trivial thing that makes them dreadful however is having no visible light to inform what mode they are in (except when charging). So it's really easy to leave them on. Which I've done after short uses (as much as I can bare). The activation/deactivation and other status voice is also hideously annoying. My Electrotops ones are much better, lighter and more comfortable. Some Philips ones I bought at Christmas as a gift are also vastly superior.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I bought these headphones as I wanted to upgrade to a set that had  ANC. This set arrived quickly thanks to Amazon Prime and well packaged. I managed to connect these up to my phone in about 30 seconds and was playing music through them in about a minute. Truly amazing. The headphones are comfortable to wear even for long periods of time and the battery life is fantastic too. The sound quality is excellent even at high levels with a good mix of bass and Hi-Fi Stereo sound. All in all I am very happy with this Bluetooth headset. They seem to be well built and made of good quality materials with some great technology inside.

Im not an audiophile so i can only give an average persons view of these when it comes to sound, i have big head and big ears and they fit fine and are a soft and comfy fit. They were really easy to pair, you just hold down the middle button for 5 seconds and it will say pairing and then its as simple as finding them on your device and pairing from there. I would say these are very heavy in the bass, on the edge of being too heavy for my taste so if you dont like base then i would give these a skip, But the sound is good and i use them mainly for watching movies while not disturbing anyone and these are great. These are very comfortable to wear, they are adjustable and they come with a charger and a little pouch for storage. I used them for jogging twice so far and I am very happy. Nothing to dislike about these headphones. I was looking around for some new headphones as my old ones; with wires attached were starting to crackle. I was looking for Bluetooth and came across these ones on the Amazon site. My collection of headphones is increasing all the time, especially in lockdown. I'm enjoying listen actively and patiently, rather than in hurry during a commute. This budget brand is such good quality for the asking price. Firstly, the sound is great; bass, treble, mids and volume. The design is modern and it feels very comfortable to wear for long periods. The controls are as easy as possible to manipulate too. I also own Skullcandy brands, and this one is a respectable budget alternative. The noise cancellation capability is another reason for me to be happy.

The SuperEQ S1 headphone is well worth considering. I wanted over ear headphones with good ingress protection for water, and these are rated IPX5. The hybrid active noise options are handy, especially when out and about. The headphones sound good, and do not distort. The multi-point dual connection worked well for me to connect to phone and notebook computer. The buttons are reasonably sized and have raised elements to indicate the function, which is good. The battery life is good, even with ANC on. There is some room for improvement. It has micro-USB rather for charging rather than USB type C. The earcups do not rotate, which can be useful. However, they feel sturdy, and I am confident that they would travel well.  I have only used them on a couple of calls, but the quality seemed fine. Overall, I am very happy with them, and at this price point, I think they deserve a 5-star rating.

Bought to replace my old set of headphones. Die OverEar-Kopfhrer tragen sich sehr angenehm, nicht nur aufgrund ihres geringes Gewichtes, auch die Ohrmuscheln bestehen aus einem weichen, gepolstertem Material. Im Lieferumfang ist noch eine Tasche fr die Kopfhrer enthalten, so knnen diese nach Gebrauch sicher verstaut werden, gerade durch den Faltmechanismus sogar recht platzsparend. Die Kopplung per Bluetooth mit Smartphone/Tablet/PC funktioniert einfach und unkompliziert. Besonders praktisch, dass sich zwei Gerte gleichzeitig mit den Kopfhrern koppeln lassen. Der Klang ist gut und fr die Preisklasse mehr als ausreichend. Weiterhin verfgen die Kopfhrer ber verschiedene Modi, wie ANC-Mode und Ambient-Mode, die sich per Knopfdruck an der rechten Kopfhrermuschel einstellen lassen. Ebenfalls lassen sich hier Lautstrke sowie das Ein- und Ausschalten fast intuitiv am Kopfhrer selbst bedienen. Fazit: Man sollte keine Highend-Kopfhrer mit allen Facetten erwarten, aber das sollte jedem bei dem recht geringen Preis bewusst sein. Dennoch bieten die Kopfhrer einen guten Klang mit vielen zustzlichen Features.

Ich vertrage leider keine In Ear Kopfhrer, da ich dann immer eine Gehrgangsentzndung bekomme. Zudem wei ich die Stille mit steigendem Alter immer mehr zu schtzen. Sprich - ich nutze die Kopfhrer auch gerne mit sehr leiser Musik oder auch mal mit white noise - also monotonen Alltagsgeruschen - und ich mu sagen, sie sind phantastisch zum abschalten. Ich kann den Alltag damit weit hinter mir lassen und gerade jetzt zu Corona Zeiten ist das fr mich sehr wichtig. Ansonsten macht der Kopfhrer einen sehr wertigen und stabilen Eindruck. Genaugenommen knnte er sogar ein bichen leichter sein, was jedoch jammern auf hohem Niveau ist. Der Ton und die Bsse sind sehr gut. Telefonieren tue ich damit nicht, dafr habe ich einen leichten Kopfhrer mit Mikro. Denke dafr ist der Kopfhrer auch nicht primr geschaffen. Sobald man wieder fliegen darf, werde ich den auf jeden Fall auch mit ins Flugzeug nehmen. Da der Akku wirklich lange hlt - mehrere Tage - je nach Nutzung bis zu 5 Tage, drfte auch ein lngerer Flug kein Problem sein. Die Verbindung via Bluetooth funktioniert perfekt. Also mir gefllt er sehr. Und ich knnte mir durchaus vorstellen, dass dieser Kopfhrer die Basis eines Markenprodukts ist. Die lassen ja ohnehin alle in China herstellen mittlerweile. Ich bin also sehr zufrieden und jetzt gehts in den Langzeittest.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video. WOW ! Wirklich, ich bin ziemlich geflasht von diesen Onear-Kopfhrern. Zuerst einmal zum Klang: Dieser ist hervorragend. Die Hhen sind sehr klar und die Bsse satt, ohne zu bersteuern. Einfach herrlich. So sollten Kopfhrer klingen ! Die Lautstrke lsst sich am rechten Hrer regulieren. Hier befindet sich auch der An/Ausschalter und der Knopf frs Noise-Cancelling, das finde ich persnlich sehr angenehm, dann damit werden Umgebungsgerusche sehr wirksam herausgefiltert, sodass man sich auf die gerade laufende Musik oder das Hrspiel konzentrieren kann. Mchte man sich unterhalten, wenn man z.B. gerade angesprochen wird, schaltet man den Transparenz-Modus ein. Dann kann man sich trotz Musik sehr gut unterhalten, ohne die Kopfhrer abnehmen zu mssen. Wirklich eine sehr gute Lsung. Der akku ist sehr schnell geladen. Ca 2 Stunden und das Gert ist wieder einsatzbereit. Ca 45 Stunden soll die Laufzeit betragen. So lange habe ich allerdings noch nicht gehrt. Bei mir kam der Kopfhrer an und ich habe ihn den ganzen Abend benutzt, ohne ihn vorher zu laden. Das waren schon ca 5 Stunden am Stck. Das Koppeln mit dem PC oder Smartphone funktioniert Kinderleicht. Bluetooth einschalten ( auf dem Kopfhrer den Koppeln Knopf auf der rechten Seite ca 3 Sekunden halten und dann auf dem PC oder Smartphone koppeln. Die Reichweite ist enorm, bei mir hatte ich ber 3 Etagen im Haus vollen Musikgenuss (Kopplung mit dem PC). Die Kopfhrer lassen sich aber auch per Klinke an den PC oder die Musikanlage anschlieen, man schont dann die Akkus. Die Ohrmuscheln sind sehr, sehr weich und liegen absolut angenehm auf den Ohren, ohne zu drcken oder nerven, auch wenn man mal eine Lesebrille aufsetzt. Hervorragend. Der Kopfhrer lsst sich zusammenklappen und in der mitgelieferten Tasche transportieren. Von mir eine absolute Kaufempfehlung und 5 Sterne !

Ich habe diese Kopfhrer als Ersatz zu meinen bisherigen Taotronics (TT-BH060 DE) bestellt. Das Design der Kopfhrer sieht ganz hbsch aus. Die rote Innenseite passt gut zum schwarzen Rest und die Oberflche ist etwas matter, somit sieht man auch nicht stndig irgendwelche Fingerabdrcke. Insgesamt also eher ein "Standard-Design", wie man es bei den meisten Kopfhrer findet. Der Klang ist gut. Insgesamt auf jeden Fall besser als bei meinen alten Taotronics Kopfhrern. Man darf natrlich nicht erwarten, dass man hier den gleichen Sound bekommt, wie bei 500+ Euro Studiokopfhrern. Positiv sticht fr mich die ANC-Leistung heraus. Ich nutze die Kopfhrer in der Regel beim Busfahren oder auch mal auf der Arbeit (Langzeitbaustelle direkt vor der Tr). Es werden deutlich mehr Gerusche herausgefiltert als bisher und im Bus hre ich quasi keinerlei andere Gerusche mehr neben der Musik. Besonders positiv finde ich, dass der Klang der Musik nicht so stark verndert wird, wenn man ANC einschaltet. Die Akkulaufzeit ist auf jeden Fall auch sehr gut. Wobei es natrlich einen Unterschied macht, ob man ANC aktiviert oder nicht. Ich kam bisher auf so etwa 40 Stunden im "Mixbetrieb" (also mal ANC aktiviert, mal deaktiviert). Das finde ich vollkommen in Ordnung zumal die Ladung auch fix geht. Im Lieferumfang waren bei mir noch ein normales 3,5mm Klinkekabel dabei und ein Mikro USB Kabel zum aufladen (leider kein Netzteil dazu, aber dies drften die meisten Zuhause haben). Insgesamt kann ich die Kopfhrer empfehlen, wenn man auf der Suche nach einem mittelpreisigen Kopfhrer ist, der ANC mitbringt.
